results.title: Father Christmas
results.creator_credit: Dave Unwin, John Coates and Blooming Productions
results.brief_description: In this charming animation based on the book by Raymond Briggs, Father Christmas decides to take a well-earned break after delivering all his presents on Christmas Eve. From France to Scotland to Las Vegas we follow the man in the red suit as he tries to relax and enjoy himself. However, this is not always easy or even possible for the busiest man in the world. A gentle parody of the English abroad, this film is a companion piece to ‘The Snowman’, another Christmas animation based on a Raymond Briggs story.

results.title: Festivals in Taiwan
results.creator_credit: Yu Ping Chung, David J.C. Shih, Weng Jeng-Yih and Goang Jiann Enterprises Corporation
results.brief_description: Chinese traditions, customs and festivals centre around the lunar calendar. In Taiwan, these customs and festivals take the form of a unique culture of temple fairs, each with their own local emphasis.

results.title: Father and daughter
results.brief_description: The poignant story of one girl’s life-long wait for her lost father. Simple brush animation takes us through a journey of time and memory in which a long for reconciliation magically occurs. Academy Award winner for Best Animation Short in 2001.

results.title: Festival in Adelaide
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, Richard Mason, Loch Townsend, Malcolm Otton, Maslyn Williams, Stanley Hawes and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows something of the preparation that went into the Adelaide Festival of Arts 1962, and excerpts from the performances themselves. General notes: AFI Award: silver award (documentary) 1963.

results.title: Father
results.creator_credit: John Power, Damien Parer, Leftbank Productions and Barron Films
results.brief_description: Internationally renowned Max von Sydow heads a cast of acclaimed actors, including Carol Drinkwater, Julia Blake and Steve Jacobs, in this powerfully moving film. It tells the story of a family whose lives are shattered when their elderly father is accused of being a Nazi war criminal. Torn between family love and loyalty and the devastating realities of wartime Nazi Germany, all relationships are tested to the limit. Photography by Dan Burstall. AFI Awards were won by Max von Sydow and Julia Blake.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Power, Damien Parer, Leftbank Productions and Barron Films

results.title: Ferris Bueller's day off [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Hughes, Tom Jacobson and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A 1961 Ferrari 250 GT California. It was one man’s love, his passion, and his fault he didn’t lock the garage when Ferris Bueller wanted the day off. One day, towards the end of his senior year, Ferris (Matthew Broderick), cuts school and heads for downtown Chicago with his girl Sloane and his best friend Cameron, to show what a little ingenuity, a lot of nerve, and a red Ferrari can do. From John Hughes comes a contemporary comedy which follows Ferris’ wildly audacious and nearly flawless plan to take it easy. Featuring a soundtrack from artists including Yello, Big Audio Dynamite, Sigue Sigue Sputnik, The Beat, The Beatles and The Dream Academy. Also stars Alan Ruck and Mia Sara. Cinematography, Tak Fujimoto. Script, John Hughes.

results.title: Ferret keeping
results.brief_description: This video covers the basics of ferret management and breeding for those keeping ferrets for working, racing, or as pets. Advice on choosing a ferret, types of housing, and what to feed them. The video follows a kit (baby ferret), from birth to its care at different ages, and covers how to train, handle and breed. The video explores the myth of ferrets being aggressive animals, revealing how engaging and good-natured they can be. Presented by James McKay, zoologist, writer, broadcaster, and internationally acknowledged as one of the world’s leading authorities on ferrets.

results.title: FernGully: the Last rainforest
results.creator_credit: Bill Kroyer, Peter Faiman, Wayne Young, Youngheart Productions and FAI Films
results.brief_description: Dedicated to “our children and our children’s children” the magical, mystical world of Fern Gully, the last rainforest takes us to a secret, special place filled with wonder and adventure where human beings exist only in fairy tales! Human hero Zak, shrunk to fairy size by Crysta joins Batty Koda, an escapee from a human lab and the denizens of the forest as they struggle to save the future of the forest from the evil enemy Hexxus. Voices include Tim Curry, Christian Slater and Robin Williams.

results.title: Fern the red deer
results.creator_credit: Jan Darnley-Smith, Adrian Worker, Children's Film and Television Foundation and De Lane Lea
results.brief_description: Fern the red deer A marvellous adventure story, filmed on location in remote Exmoor, about an abandoned deer calf. The deer calf forms a bond with two young children and together they fight for the wild deer’s survival.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jan Darnley-Smith, Adrian Worker, Children’s Film and Television Foundation and De Lane Lea
